candidates.title: Was Kirk Cameron Diagnosed With a Rare Form of Leprosy?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Actor Kirk Cameron has contracted an extremely rare form of leprosy.
On 26 July 2017, TheLastLineOfDefense.com published a shocking article about an unexpected diagnosis for former child actor Kirk Cameron:
Actor, musician, director and devoted follower of Christ, Kirk Cameron, has been stricken with an extremely rare form of what can only be described as a biblical disease. Cameron has a mutated form of leprosy that is so rare, less than one in 600 million people will ever encounter someone who has it.
The strain, leprosis metapupalis carnivore, essentially turns its victim into a walking pile of dead skin, rotting flesh, and festering organs while keeping the brain functioning at primal levels and the heart pumping just enough to send diseased blood to the marrow and muscles to allow the person to be mobile.
This is not a genuine news item. TheLastLineOfDefense.com is an entertainment web site that does not publish factual stories, and carries multiple disclaimers labeling its content as fiction:
In a cynical world where the news of the day often seems fake, The Last Line of Defense offers today's busy conservative a place to go to read things they'll enjoy and congregate with a bunch of people they agree with. So while everything on this site is a satirical work of fiction, we are proud to present it to those who will have called it real anyway.
DISCLAIMER: Americas Last Line of Defense is a satirical publication that may sometimes appear to be telling the truth. We assure you thats not the case. We present fiction as fact and our sources dont actually exist. Names that represent actual people and places are purely coincidental and all images should be considered altered and do not in any way depict reality.
In other words, if you believe this crap youre a real dumbass.
candidates.description: A shocking report about the former child actor was just another hoax from a well-known purveyor of satire.

result.explanation: The news caption is directly quoted from a satirical website, TheLastLineOfDefense.com, as noted in the provided evidence from Snopes.  Snopes explicitly states that this website publishes fictional content and that the claim about Kirk Cameron's illness is false. Therefore, the caption's claim is not supported by credible evidence.
result.supporting_points: Source 1 states that the claim originates from TheLastLineOfDefense.com, a satirical website that presents fiction as fact.  The source also includes a disclaimer explicitly stating that the content is not real.  The claim is labeled as a hoax by Snopes.

final_result.explanation: The internal check analyzes the image and caption, concluding that the caption is consistent with Kirk Cameron's public persona. However, the external check reveals that the source of the caption is a satirical website, TheLastLineOfDefense.com, known for publishing fictional content. Snopes, a reputable fact-checking website, has debunked this claim, confirming the information as false. The discrepancy highlights the importance of verifying information from multiple reliable sources.  The internal check, while finding a superficial agreement, lacks the crucial element of truth verification. The external check provides conclusive evidence against the caption's veracity. The image itself shows Kirk Cameron speaking, which aligns with his public appearances as an actor and Christian speaker; however, this doesn't confirm the claim of a biblical disease.  The internal check's confidence is high because the superficial agreement between the image and the caption description of Kirk Cameron is easily confirmed by readily available information about him. The external check, however, has a similarly high confidence score because Snopes is a reliable source, and its fact-check leaves no room for doubt.  The conflicting results underscore the danger of relying solely on surface-level consistency between a picture and a claim.  Ultimately, the external evidence from Snopes overrides the superficial internal consistency. The claim is demonstrably false and the caption is out of context because it presents fabricated information as a factual news report.
final_result.validation_summary: Internal check finds superficial consistency between the image and caption details.  External check reveals the caption originates from a satirical website and is debunked by Snopes. The external evidence overrides the internal assessment, confirming the caption as out of context.
